result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Cases called at 10:00 AM: 22CF1116, 21CT330, 22CF49, 22CF441. Hearing held via Zoom video conferencing.
Defendant Phillip E Chism appeared by telephone.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared by telephone for Phillip E Chism.  Attorney Andrew Gunderson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant was his right to personal appearance.
22CF1116: Defendant waives reading of Complaint and Time Limits for Preliminary Hearing.  $1,000 Signature Bond Set. Defendant ordered to sign the bond at the Clerk of Courts Office. 
Eau Claire JA to schedule Preliminary Hearing in intake with 21CT330, 22CF49, 22CF441 to ride along.
STC in all cases: 12/22/22 at 9:45 AM.
Status conference on October 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:50 AM cases 21CT330, 22CF49, 22CF441 called. Defendant Phillip E Chism not in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared by video for Phillip E Chism.  Prosecuting attorney Peter J. Rindal appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
There is a phone connected but not identifying and unable to unmute after giving direction as to how to unmute. State requests a warrant- Warrant is ordered but Stayed until Tuesday 9/6/22 end of day.
10:14 AM cases 21CT330, 22CF49, 22CF441 re called. Defendant Phillip E Chism in court by video.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared by video for Phillip E Chism.  Prosecuting attorney Monica Fallon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. The stayed warrant is quashed. 
In 22CF441 and 22CF49: Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas- Received by the Court. 
If defendant would like to substitute the assigned branch, Defense is to file the substitution by the end of the day. Defense provides their phone number to the defendant. 
All files: Thursday October 20, 2022 at 10:00 AM (via Zoom).
Arraignment on September 1, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Arraignment on August 17, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Same as Complaint.
Arraignment on August 17, 2022 at 09:45 am.
